publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2130 Margaret Jamieson: Jimmy Knapp—That the Parliament regrets the passing of Jimmy Knapp, General Secretary of the Rail, Maritime and Transport Union; notes Jimmy’s vital contribution to the labour and trade union movement over many years; sends its deepest condolences to his family, friends and colleagues, who have lost a great friend and leader; notes that his love of the railways and his concern for the working conditions of his fellow workers were founded in his upbringing in Hurlford in Ayrshire and that he never lost sight of his roots throughout his long and distinguished national and international career in the movement, and believes that Jimmy is a loss not only to the people of Scotland and the UK but also to the wider labour movement throughout the world.

S1M-2130 Margaret Jamieson: Jimmy Knapp—That the Parliament regrets the passing of Jimmy Knapp, General Secretary of the Rail, Maritime and Transport Union; notes Jimmy’s vital contribution to the labour and trade union movement over many years; sends its deepest condolences to his family, friends and colleagues, who have lost a great friend and leader; notes that his love of the railways and his concern for the working conditions of his fellow workers were founded in his upbringing in Hurlford in Ayrshire and that he never lost sight of his roots throughout his long and distinguished national and international career in the movement, and believes that Jimmy is a loss not only to the people of Scotland and the UK but also to the wider labour movement throughout the world.
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Trish Godman*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Alex Neil*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Maureen Macmillan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Christine Grahame*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Elaine Smith*

S1M-2130 Margaret Jamieson: Jimmy Knapp-That the Parliament regrets the passing of Jimmy Knapp, General Secretary of the Rail, Maritime and Transport Union; notes Jimmy's vital contribution to the labour and trade union movement over many years; sends its deepest condolences to his family, friends and colleagues, who have lost a great friend and leader; notes that his love of the railways and his concern for the working conditions of his fellow workers were founded in his upbringing in Hurlford in Ayrshire and that he never lost sight of his roots throughout his long and distinguished national and international career in the movement, and believes that Jimmy is a loss not only to the people of Scotland and the UK but also to the wider labour movement throughout the world. Supported by: Trish Godman, Alex Neil, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Brian Fitzpatrick, Maureen Macmillan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine Grahame, Cathy Jamieson, Dr Elaine Murray, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith, Mr Frank McAveety*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*, Patricia Ferguson*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Scott Barrie*, Karen Whitefield*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Cathie Craigie*, Rhoda Grant*, Mr Andy Kerr*, Hugh Henry*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Michael Russell*, Des McNulty*
S1M-2130 Jimmy Knapp (lodged on 27 August 2001) Janis Hughes*, Karen Gillon*
